bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Applicaton of George Hawkins for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

TO THE HONORABLE C.S. HANFORD, JUDGE OF THE ABOVE ENTITLED COURT. The petition of George Hawkins respectfully shows to your Honor; I. That he is now prisoned and restraned of his liberty by the Warden of the United States Penitentiary at McNeil's Island in the State of Washington; II. That the cause or pretense of the restraint of your said petitioner, according to the best of the knowledge and belief of the petitioner, is as follows;- That on the 23rd day of January A.D. 1901. your said petitioner was indicted by the Grand Jury inand for the Second Division, District of Alaska, for the crime of robbery, a certified copy of which said indictment is hereto annexed, marked "Exhibit A" and made a part of this petition. III. That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in the said United States District Court in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, upon said indictment that the said petitioner was tried upon and convicted of the charge contained in said indictmnt, and thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in the said United States District Court in and for the District of Alalska, Second Division, that your said petitioner was by the judgment of the said United States District Court, in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, sentenced to be confined in the United States Penitentiary at McNeil's Island, in the State of Washington, for a period of fifteen years: thatthereafter much proceedings were had and taken in said United States District Court, in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, upon the said judgment and sentence that the Honorable Arthur H. Hoyes, Judge of the United States District Court, in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, issued
a commitment upon said judgment and sentence, a certified copy of which commitment is hereto annexed, marked "Exhibit B" and made a part hereof. That thereafter much proceedings were had and taken in the said United States District Court, in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, that said petitioner prosecuted a writ of error from the said judgment and sentence to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals, in and for the Ninth Circuit; that thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in the said United States Circuit Court of Appeals that an application was made for and on behalf of your said petitioner to have your said petititoner admitted to bail pending the hearing and determination of the cause of your said petitioner upon said writ of error in the said Circuit Court of Appeals; that thereafter such proceedings were had and taken
